description: This Notification is generated when the MPLS module changes state
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsStateChange TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsGeneralAdminState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsGeneralOperState i 1

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: When vRtrMplsGeneralAdminState is set to 'inService', the agent
attempts to enable the MPLS protocol instance on this router.
When vRtrMplsGeneralAdminState is set to 'outOfService', the agent
attempts to disable the MPLS protocol instance on this router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsGeneralAdminState

description: vRtrMplsGeneralOperState indicates the current operating state of this
MPLS protocol instance on this router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsGeneralOperState

description: This Notification is generated when the MPLS interface changes state
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIfStateChange TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex i 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIfAdminState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIfOperState i 1

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: The unique value which identifies this interface of this virtual
router in the Tmnx system. This field provides an identifier for
virtual router interfaces similar to the ifIndex values used in the
mib-2 interfaces table for physical interfaces. The vRtrIfIndex values
can be reused for different virtual routers, but are unique within
those entries with the same vRtrID.
The vRtrIfIndex value for each virtual interface must remain constant
at least from one re-initialization of the system management processor
to the next.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex

description: The desired administrative state for the MPLS protocol running on this
MPLS interface.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIfAdminState

description: This variable indicates the current status of the MPLS protocol
running on this MPLS interface. When the
TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfPortID object of this interface is set to a
loopback port identifier, the operational state is not relevant and an
SNMP GET request on this object will return 'unknown'.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIfOperState

description: This Notification is generated when a LSP transitions to the
'inService' state from any other state.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspUp TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspIndex u 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspAdminState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspOperState i 1

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspIndex specifies the Labeled Switch
Path (LSP) index for this virtual router in the Nokia
SROS system. It is a unique value among entries with the
same value of vRtrID.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspIndex

description: The desired administrative state for this LSP.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspAdminState

description: The current operational state of this LSP.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspOperState

description: This Notification is generated when an LSP transitions out of
'inService' state to any other state.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspDown TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspIndex u 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspAdminState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspOperState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspNotificationReasonCode i 0

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspIndex specifies the Labeled Switch
Path (LSP) index for this virtual router in the Nokia
SROS system. It is a unique value among entries with the
same value of vRtrID.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspIndex

description: The desired administrative state for this LSP.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspAdminState

description: The current operational state of this LSP.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspOperState

description: Used by vRtrMplsLspDown, the value indicates the reason for the LSP
going down.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspNotificationReasonCode

description: This Notification is generated when a LSP Path transitions to the
'inService' state from any other state.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathUp TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspIndex u 9999 MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsTunnelIndex.21 i 9999 MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsTunnelInstance i 999 MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsTunnelIngressLSRId u 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathAdminState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathOperState i 1

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspIndex specifies the Labeled Switch
Path (LSP) index for this virtual router in the Nokia
SROS system. It is a unique value among entries with the
same value of vRtrID.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspIndex

description: Uniquely identifies this row.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsTunnelIndex

description: Uniquely identifies an instance of a tunnel. It is
useful to identify multiple instances of tunnels
for the purposes of backup and parallel tunnels.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsTunnelInstance

description: The purpose of this object is to uniquely identity
a tunnel within a network. When the MPLS
signalling protoocol is rsvp(2) this value should
mimic the Extended Tunnel Id field in the Session
object. When the MPLS signalling protoocol is
crldp(3) this value should mimic the Ingress LSR
Router ID field in the LSPID TLV object.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsTunnelIngressLSRId

description: The desired administrative state for this LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathAdminState

description: The current operational state of this LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathOperState

description: This Notification is generated when a LSP Path transitions out of
'inService' state to any other state.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathDown TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspIndex u 9999 MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsTunnelIndex.21 i 9999 MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsTunnelInstance i 9999 MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsTunnelIngressLSRId u 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathAdminState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathOperState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathNotificationReasonCode i 0

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx

variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspIndex

description: Uniquely identifies this row.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsTunnelIndex

description: Uniquely identifies an instance of a tunnel. It is

for the purposes of backup and parallel tunnels.

description: The purpose of this object is to uniquely identity

variables.name: MPLS-TE-MIB::mplsTunnelIngressLSRId

description: The desired administrative state for this LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathAdminState

description: The current operational state of this LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathOperState

description: Used by vRtrMplsLspPathDown, the value indicates the reason for the
LSP path going down.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathNotificationReasonCode

description: The vRtrMplsLspPathRerouted notification is generated when an LSP Path
is rerouted.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathRerouted TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathAdminState.1.2.3.4.5 i 2 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathOperState i 2

description: The desired administrative state for this LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathAdminState

description: The current operational state of this LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathOperState

description: The vRtrMplsLspPathResignaled notification is generated when an LSP
Path is resignalled. The vRtrMplsLspPathLastMBBType indicates the
reason why the LSP Path was resignalled.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathResignaled TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathAdminState.1.2.3.4.5 i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathOperState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathLastMBBType i 6

description: The desired administrative state for this LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathAdminState

description: The current operational state of this LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathOperState

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspPathLastMBBType indicates the type of
last Make-before-break (MBB). If 'none', then no MBB has been
attempted.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathLastMBBType

description: This Notification is generated when a P2MP instance transitions to the
'inService' state from any other state.

event.Summary: Router MPLS P2MP instance ($v3) is up

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstanceUp TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspIndex u 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstNotifIndex u 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstAdminState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstOperState i 1

variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstNotifIndex

description: The value of vRtrMplsP2mpInstAdminState specifies desired

variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstAdminState

description: The value of vRtrMplsP2mpInstOperState indicates the current

variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstOperState

description: This Notification is generated when a P2MP instance transitions out of

description: This Notification is generated when a S2l sub LSP transitions to the

last Make-before-break (MBB). If 'none', then no MBB has been
attempted.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsS2lSubLspLastMBBType

description: The vRtrMplsLspPathSoftPreempted notification is generated when an LSP
Path is soft-preempted.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathSoftPreempted TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathAdminState.1.2.3.4 i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathOperState i 1

description: The desired administrative state for this LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathAdminState

description: The current operational state of this LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathOperState

description: The vRtrMplsLspPathLstFillReoptElig notification is set/reset based on
when a timer based resignal found/did not find a path with the same
cost but which has a better least-fill metric.

Summary.eval: ($v1==1) ? 'LSP path is eligible for resignaling' : 'LSP path is not eligible for resignaling'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathLstFillReoptElig TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathResignalEligible.1.2.3.4 i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathCongChgPercent u 9999

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspPathResignalEligible indicates that the LSP
path is eligible for resignaling on the basis of available bandwidth.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathResignalEligible

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspPathCongChgPercent indicates the percentage
change in congestion.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathCongChgPercent

description: This Notification is generated when a P2MP instance is resignalled.
The vRtrMplsP2mpInstLastMBBType indicates the reason why the P2MP
instance was resignalled.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstanceResignaled TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspIndex u 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstNotifIndex u 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstAdminState.2 i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstOperState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstLastMBBType i 4

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspIndex specifies the Labeled Switch
Path (LSP) index for this virtual router in the Nokia
SROS system. It is a unique value among entries with the
same value of vRtrID.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspIndex

description: The unique value which identifies this Point to Multipoint Labeled
Switch Path (P2MP LSP) for this virtual router in the Nokia
SROS system. It is a unique value among entries with the
same value of vRtrID.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstNotifIndex

description: The value of vRtrMplsP2mpInstAdminState specifies desired
administrative state for this P2MP LSP.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstAdminState

description: The value of vRtrMplsP2mpInstOperState indicates the current
operational state of this P2MP LSP.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstOperState

description: The value of vRtrMplsP2mpInstLastMBBType indicates the type of
last Make-before-break (MBB). If 'none', then no MBB has been
attempted.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsP2mpInstLastMBBType

description: The vRtrMplsResignalTimerExpired notification is generated when the
resignal timer expires for a MPLS instance. Make before break (MBB)
would be started only on those P2P LSP (Point to Point) paths that
need to be resignalled. vRtrMplsGeneralResignalTimer would be reset
once this notification is sent.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsResignalTimerExpired TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsGeneralResignalTimer.12 u 9999

description: The value of vRtrMplsGeneralResignalTimer specifies the value for the
P2P (point-to-point) LSP resignal timer, that is the time, in minutes
the software will wait before attempting to resignal the P2P LSPs.
When the resignal timer expires, if the new recorded hop list (RRO)
for an P2P LSP has a better metric than the current recorded hop list
an attempt will be made to resignal that P2P LSP using the
make-before-break mechanism. If the attempt to resignal an P2P LSP
fails, the P2P LSP will continue to use the existing path and a
resignal will be attempted the next time the timer expires.
A value of 0 for the resignal timer indicates that timer-based P2P LSP
resignalling has been disabled.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsGeneralResignalTimer

description: The vRtrMplsLspPathMbbStatusEvent notification is generated to report
the status of the make-before-break(MBB) operation for the LSP path.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathMbbStatusEvent TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathAdminState.1.2.3.4.5 i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathOperState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathLastMBBType i 0 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathMbbStatus i 0 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathMbbReasonCode i 0

description: The desired administrative state for this LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathAdminState

description: The current operational state of this LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathOperState

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspPathLastMBBType indicates the type of
last Make-before-break (MBB). If 'none', then no MBB has been
attempted.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathLastMBBType

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspPathMbbStatus indicates the status of the
make-before-break (MBB) operation for the LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathMbbStatus

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspPathMbbReasonCode indicates the reason code
for the make-before-break (MBB) operation of the LSP path. It
indicates whether the operation is failed, aborted or ignored.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathMbbReasonCode

description: [CAUSE] The vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyFailure notification is generated to
report an unsuccessful switchover from the current active secondary
LSP path of an LSP to another secondary standby LSP path. The reason
for the failure is specified by vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyReasonCode.
[EFFECT] The switchover to the new standby path failed for the LSP.
[RECOVERY] The vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyReasonCode will help the user
troubleshoot the failure. The user can attempt to switchover to
another standby LSP path again.

event.Summary: Failed to switch a new standby path from the current active standby path due to $v7

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyFailure TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspIndex u 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspAdminState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspOperState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPathForce i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPathIndex i 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyReasonCode i 0

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspIndex specifies the Labeled Switch
Path (LSP) index for this virtual router in the Nokia
SROS system. It is a unique value among entries with the
same value of vRtrID.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspIndex

description: The desired administrative state for this LSP.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspAdminState

description: The current operational state of this LSP.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspOperState

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPathForce specifies whether to force
a switch from an active LSP path to a new standby path as specified by
the values of vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPathIndex and
vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPath.
When vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPathForce variable is specified
vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPathIndex and vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPath must be
also be specified.
A value of 'true' for vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPathForce specifies
a forced switch. A value of 'false' specifies no forced switch.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPathForce

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPathIndex specifies the index for
the new standby LSP path in mplsTunnelTable.
vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPath must also be set to 'doAction' for the new
standby LSP path to be selected.
A value of 0 specifies that the best active path will be selected.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPathIndex

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyReasonCode indicates the reason for
the failure of switch to a new standby path from the current active
standby path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyReasonCode

description: [CAUSE] The vRtrMplsLspActivePathChanged notification is generated
when the active path of an LSP successfully switches to an new path.
This notification will also be sent when the active LSP path does not
change but only the switch method changes on the path.
The old LSP path index is specified by vRtrMplsLspOldTunnelIndex.
The state and switch method of the current active LSP path are
specified by vRtrMplsLspPathState and vRtrMplsLspPathActiveByManual
respectively.
[EFFECT] The switchover to the new LSP path was successful
and/or the switch method of the current active LSP path changed.
[RECOVERY] There is no recovery required for this notification.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspActivePathChanged TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathState.1.2.3.4.5 i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathActiveByManual i 0 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspOldTunnelIndex i 9999

description: The current working state of this path within this LSP.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathState

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspPathActiveByManual indicates whether
a secondary standby path has become the active LSP path
due to manual intervention. When vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPath is set
to 'doAction' a manual switch is attempted. When
vRtrMplsLspSwitchStbyPathForce is set to 'true' the manual switch is
forced.
When the value of vRtrMplsLspPathActiveByManual is set to
'notApplicable', the LSP path is active but not due to any manual
intervention.
When the value of vRtrMplsLspPathActiveByManual is set to 'noForce'
the LSP path has become active by a manual switch specified by the
user.
When the value of vRtrMplsLspPathActiveByManual is set to 'force', the
LSP path has become active by a forced manual switch executed by the
user.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspPathActiveByManual

description: The value of vRtrMplsLspOldTunnelIndex indicates the tunnel index of
of the old LSP path.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLspOldTunnelIndex

description: [CAUSE] vRtrMplsXCBundleChange is generated when one or more RSVP
sessions changed state and retained the changed state for an entire
quiet interval of 2 minutes or the maximum interval of 10 minutes if
the state of RSVP sessions kept on changing during this period of
multiple quiet intervals.
[EFFECT] RSVP sessions represented by bits in
vRtrMplsXCNotifRednIndicesBitMap changed state on this router
instance.
[RECOVERY] There is no recovery required for this notification.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsXCBundleChange TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsXCNotifRednIndicesBitMap s EXAMPLE TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednBundlingType i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednNumOfBitsSet u 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednStartIndex u 999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednEndIndex u 9999

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: The value of vRtrMplsXCNotifRednIndicesBitMap indicates the RSVP
sessions that either changed state and retained the changed state for
the entire quiet interval of 2 minutes or the RSVP sessions that
changed state during multiple intervals until a maximum interval of 10
minutes has elapsed.
Each bit location in vRtrMplsXCNotifRednIndicesBitMap corresponds to a
created or deleted row entry in vRtrMplsXCTable as identified by the
value of vRtrMplsXCIndex. This index is same as the value of
TIMETRA-RSVP-MIB::vRtrRsvpSessionIndex which corresponds to a created
or deleted RSVP session entry in
TIMETRA-RSVP-MIB::vRtrRsvpSessionTable.
The value of vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednStartIndex indicates the index value
of the first affected row entry Represented by bit 0, the most
significant bit.
If the value of vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednBundlingType is set to 'create
(2)', all the bits set in vRtrMplsXCNotifRednIndicesBitMap represent
created RSVP sessions. If the value of
vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednBundlingType is set to 'delete (1)', all the bits
set in vRtrMplsXCNotifRednIndicesBitMap represent deleted RSVP
sessions.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsXCNotifRednIndicesBitMap

description: The value of vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednBundlingType indicates whether this
notification is generated for deletion or creation of RSVP sessions on
this ingress, transit or egress router instance.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednBundlingType

description: The value of vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednNumOfBitsSet indicates the total
number of bits set in vRtrMplsXCNotifRednIndicesBitMap.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednNumOfBitsSet

description: The value of vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednStartIndex indicates which
vRtrMplsXCIndex is represented by the first bit in
vRtrMplsXCNotifRednIndicesBitMap.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednStartIndex

description: The value of vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednEndIndex indicates which
vRtrMplsXCIndex is represented by the last bit in
vRtrMplsXCNotifRednIndicesBitMap.
The value vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednEndIndex can be useful for a sanity
check of vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednNumOfBitsSet.
vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednNumOfBitsSet. = (vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednEndIndex -
vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednStartIndex + 1).
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsXCNotifyRednEndIndex

description: [CAUSE] vRtrMplsLblRangeModify is generated when the values of
vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticLspLabels or vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticSvcLabels
have been modified.
[EFFECT] The maximum static labels are modified.
[RECOVERY] There is no recovery required for this notification.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLblRangeModify TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticLspLabels u 453 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticSvcLabels u 234

description: The value of vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticLspLabels specifies the maximum
number of Static LSP labels available on the system.
vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticLspLabels must be set along with
vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticSvcLabels. The total of both values should equal
the maximum value allowed of 131040 or 262112 depending on the system.
The maximum value of vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticLspLabels value for most
systems is 113040 labels (128 * 1024 less 32 reserved labels).
The maximum value of vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticLspLabels value for chassis
mode D systems is 262112 labels (256 * 1024 less 32 reserved labels).
vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticLspLabels is obsoleted in 13.0, replaced by
vRtrMplsLabelStaticLabelRange.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticLspLabels

description: The value of vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticSvcLabels specifies the maximum
number of Static SVC labels available on the system.
vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticSvcLabels must be set along with
vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticLspLabels. The total of both values should equal
the maximum value allowed of 113040 or 262112 depending on the system.
The maximum value of vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticLspLabels value for most
systems is 113040 labels (128 * 1024 less 32 reserved labels).
The maximum value of vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticLspLabels value for chassis
mode D systems is 262112 labels (256 * 1024 less 32 reserved labels).
vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticSvcLabels is obsoleted in 13.0, replaced by
vRtrMplsLabelStaticLabelRange.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsLabelMaxStaticSvcLabels

description: [CAUSE] The vRtrMplsNodeInIgpOverload notification is generated when
MPLS gets a notification that a node is in IGP overload state.
[EFFECT] The LSPs transiting through nodes that are in IGP overload
state are teardown.
[RECOVERY] There is no recovery required for this notification.

Summary.eval: ($v1==1) ? 'Node is in IGP overload state' : 'Node is not in IGP overload state'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsNodeInIgpOverload TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsGenRetryOnIgpOverload.12 i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIgpOverloadRtrAddrType i 0 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIgpOverloadRtrAddr x 0x7f000001 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIgpOverloadIgpType i 1

description: The value of vRtrMplsGenRetryOnIgpOverload specifies whether or not to
teardown LSPs transiting through nodes that are in IGP overload state.
When the value of vRtrMplsGenRetryOnIgpOverload is set to 'true' and a
node is reporting that it is in IGP overload state, MPLS will tear-
down and retry LSP paths that are transiting through the overloaded
node.
When the value of vRtrMplsGenRetryOnIgpOverload is set to 'false' and
a node is reporting that it is in IGP overload state, MPLS will not
tear down LSP paths that are transiting through the overloaded node.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsGenRetryOnIgpOverload

description: The value of vRtrMplsIgpOverloadRtrAddrType indicates the address type
of vRtrMplsIgpOverloadRtrAddr.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIgpOverloadRtrAddrType

description: The value of vRtrMplsIgpOverloadRtrAddr indicates the IP address of
the router that is in IGP overload state.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIgpOverloadRtrAddr

description: The value of vRtrMplsIgpOverloadIgpType indicates IGP which is
notifying MPLS that a node is in the overload state.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIgpOverloadIgpType

description: [CAUSE] The vRtrMplsIPv6StateChange notification is generated when
MPLS protocol instance changes state.
[EFFECT] The SR-TE LSPs with IPv6 addresses transition state.
[RECOVERY] There is no recovery required for this notification.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIPv6StateChange TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsGeneralAdminState i 1 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsGeneralV6OperState i 1

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: When vRtrMplsGeneralAdminState is set to 'inService', the agent
attempts to enable the MPLS protocol instance on this router.
When vRtrMplsGeneralAdminState is set to 'outOfService', the agent
attempts to disable the MPLS protocol instance on this router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsGeneralAdminState

description: vRtrMplsGeneralV6OperState indicates the current operating state of
MPLS protocol instance on this router for srte ipv6.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsGeneralV6OperState

description: [CAUSE] The vRtrMplsIPv6StateChange notification is generated when
MPLS interface changes state.
[EFFECT] The SR-TE LSPs with IPv6 addresses transition state.
[RECOVERY] There is no recovery required for this notification.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIfIPv6StateChange TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex i 9999 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIfAdminState i 2 TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIfV6OperState i 2

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: The unique value which identifies this interface of this virtual
router in the Tmnx system. This field provides an identifier for
virtual router interfaces similar to the ifIndex values used in the
mib-2 interfaces table for physical interfaces. The vRtrIfIndex values
can be reused for different virtual routers, but are unique within
those entries with the same vRtrID.
The vRtrIfIndex value for each virtual interface must remain constant
at least from one re-initialization of the system management processor
to the next.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex

description: The desired administrative state for the MPLS protocol running on this
MPLS interface.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIfAdminState

description: This variable indicates the current status of the MPLS protocol
running on this MPLS interface for srte ipv6. When the
TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfPortID object of this interface is set to a
loopback port identifier, the operational state is not relevant and an
SNMP GET request on this object will return 'unknown'.
variables.name: TIMETRA-MPLS-MIB::vRtrMplsIfV6OperState
